name: keyboard
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A2 the set of keys on a computer or typewriter that you press in order to make it work : Switch off the computer and unplug the keyboard. The computer comes with a wireless mouse and keyboard.
Image Source/Image Source/GettyImages
the row of keys on a musical instrument such as a piano: The width of piano keyboards became standard in the mid-1800s. Despite her expert fingering on the keyboard, she is simply too detached emotionally to be a great pianist.
A2 an electronic musical instrument similar to a piano: In front of him is an electronic keyboard. He briefly played keyboards with rock-and-roller John Mellencamp.
Cimmerian/E+/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesYou can move the cursor either by using the mouse or by using the arrow keys on the keyboard.She told us how easy it was to use the computer, then by way of demonstration simply pressed a few keys on the keyboard.an electronic keyboardThe keyboard was fitted with a non-standard plug.The keyboard plugs in at the back of the computer.

Operating computers
keyboard noun [C]
(COMPUTER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the set of keys arranged in rows that you use to operate a computer
keyboard noun [C]
(MUSICAL INSTRUMENT)
a musical instrument having keys like a piano, or the set of keys on this type of instrument: Steve plays keyboards, drums, and saxophone.
Add to word list
Add to word list
IT the board with a set of keys on a computer, etc. to type information or that you use in order to make it work: I prefer to use the keyboard rather than a mouse. This is a wireless keyboard with all the latest features.
IT to put information into a computer using a keyboard: Who is going to keyboard all the data? Compare
key verb keyboarding noun [ U ]
IT The costs of keyboarding must be added to the first costs.
